Description: Warrior's head dress, consisting of a skin circlet with two rows of white cowrie shells and with a fringe of black human hair.
Curator's comments: Slip: "The Shillook. Central Africa. From Petherick collection". See John Petherick, Egypt, the Soudan and Central Africa, 1861, p.353: (on the Shillook) ‘The head is decorated with small skull-cps of black ostrich feathers, the tops directed to the back, not infrequently ornamented with a circle of cowry-shells in the centre.’
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: John Petherick (sale London Bullock 27.vi.1862, lot 89)
